com.github.hotware.lucene.extension.bean.annotations

Annotation Type BeanField


  • @Target(value=FIELD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface BeanField
    Annotation for Beans that should be stored into lucene Use this class in addition with a BeanConverter Implementation From the Lucene-Wiki:
    What is the different between Stored, Tokenized, Indexed, and Vector? Stored = as-is value stored in the Lucene index Tokenized = field is analyzed using the specified Analyzer - the tokens emitted are indexed Indexed = the text (either as-is with keyword fields, or the tokens from tokenized fields) is made searchable (aka inverted) Vectored = term frequency per document is stored in the index in an easily retrievable fashion.

    Note: Default values correspond to the way FieldType handles things. The FieldInfo.DocValuesType has to be handled via a custom Type as it's default is null in the FieldType class.
    Author:
    Martin Braun
